channel.title: The theme park discussion thread
channel.description: Here you can say your opinion about amusement parks and recommend stuff for people, talk about Knotts Berry Farm and Six Flags :slight_smile: . I'll start off with my favorite roller coaster. Silver Bullet at Knotts Berry Farm, bit shaky though.

item.title: The theme park discussion thread
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I thought I was just getting old when I found I didn’t enjoy Elich gardens six flags here in Denver. Then I went back to my home town and took a trip to Marriott’s six flags in Gurnee Illinois and realized that it wasn’t me getting old. It was the rides were made too small/short/compacted.

The rides at Marriott’s six flags have plenty of room to grow and glide. good stuff man. Gimme a great roller coaster any day!

Read full topic

item.title: The theme park discussion thread
item.dc:creator: Cookiekiller6
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Is LEGO for fags and twats only? I must be queen of all twatfags then.

I think he meant LegoLand. Not legos. Heh, I just noticed you could call Legoland Pregoland. Thats not funny is it.:’(

Read full topic

item.title: The theme park discussion thread
item.dc:creator: Cookiekiller6
item.description:
Well I guess I’ve been a bit wimpy, now that I’ve watched Extreme Terror Rides, California Screamin’ looks like walking to school would be about as much fun. Wow, it sucks Six Flags is like 8 hours away or something. And when my family passed it on a vacation one time, it was like 4 hours of traffic going the opposite way, suckers

Read full topic

item.title: The theme park discussion thread
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
I won’t even tell you the stories about the tips when the high rollers had a good evening in the casino. Plus he got to see a lot of the world. He’s been skiing in Alaska and taken flying lessons in Mexico City, amongst many other things.

item.title: The theme park discussion thread
item.dc:creator: Cookiekiller6
item.description:
raw_bean:

I have a friend who worked on cruise ships as a croupier, and he was in international waters all the time. It was cool because there were no taxes on his wages since they were being earned in a place that no government had claim to so he got paid bucketloads and had free room and board.

Thats awesome.
Lucky…:hmph:

Read full topic

item.title: The theme park discussion thread
item.dc:creator: klaymore
item.description:
ehhhhh, To really be viable it would probably have to be in international waters on a huge fucking island due to the amounts traffic from across the globe if you wanted it off shore. I don’t think a country would want that much foreign traffic to deal with. what with inspections, passports and crap

Not on an Island though, fuck that shit. would be SO expensive to frequent let alone visit

It depends. If it’s not too far from the coast people could use a boat instead of an helicopter.
